statements: SELECT * FROM anomaly_detection_data WHERE id = 1;
SELECT value, timestamp FROM anomaly_detection_data WHERE value > 50;
SELECT id FROM anomaly_detection_data WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01 00:00:00' AND '2022-01-31 23:59:59';
SELECT * FROM anomaly_detection_data ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT AVG(value) AS avg_value FROM anomaly_detection_data;
SELECT * FROM anomaly_detection_data ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT id, value FROM anomaly_detection_data WHERE value > 100 ORDER BY id ASC
SELECT id, timestamp, value FROM anomaly_detection_data WHERE timestamp >= '2022-01-01' AND timestamp < '2022-02-01'
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM anomaly_detection_data
SELECT AVG(value) AS average_value FROM anomaly_detection_data
SELECT * FROM anomaly_events;
SELECT event_id, event_description FROM anomaly_events;
SELECT event_id, event_timestamp, event_description FROM anomaly_events ORDER BY event_timestamp DESC;
SELECT log_id, event_id, log_timestamp FROM anomaly_logs WHERE event_id = 1;
SELECT log_id, event_id, log_timestamp, log_description FROM anomaly_logs ORDER BY log_timestamp;
SELECT * FROM anomaly_events WHERE event_id = 1;
SELECT event_description, event_timestamp FROM anomaly_events WHERE event_id > 5 ORDER BY event_timestamp DESC;
SELECT log_description, log_timestamp, event_description FROM anomaly_logs INNER JOIN anomaly_events ON anomaly_logs.event_id = anomaly_events.event_id;
SELECT MAX(log_timestamp) AS latest_log_timestamp FROM anomaly_logs;
SELECT event_id, COUNT(log_id) AS log_count FROM anomaly_logs GROUP BY event_id HAVING log_count >= 3 ORDER BY log_count DESC;
SELECT * FROM historical_data LIMIT 5
SELECT id, timestamp, value, description FROM historical_data WHERE value > 100 ORDER BY timestamp DESC
SELECT id, description, value FROM historical_data WHERE value < 50 ORDER BY id ASC
SELECT * FROM historical_data WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31' ORDER BY value ASC
SELECT description, COUNT(*) AS count FROM historical_data GROUP BY description HAVING count > 1
SELECT * FROM historical_data WHERE value > 100 ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT id, timestamp, description FROM historical_data WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31' ORDER BY timestamp ASC
SELECT AVG(value) AS avg_value, DATE(timestamp) AS date FROM historical_data GROUP BY DATE(timestamp)
SELECT id, timestamp, value, description FROM historical_data WHERE value < 50 AND description LIKE '%important%'
SELECT MAX(value) AS max_value, MIN(value) AS min_value FROM historical_data
SELECT * FROM historical_data;
SELECT id, timestamp FROM anomaly_logs WHERE anomaly_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
SELECT value, timestamp FROM historical_data ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT anomaly_id, resolution_status FROM anomaly_history WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31';
SELECT * FROM anomalies LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM historical_data ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT id, timestamp, value FROM historical_data WHERE value > 100 ORDER BY timestamp ASC;
SELECT anomalies.*, anomaly_logs.timestamp FROM anomalies JOIN anomaly_logs ON anomalies.id = anomaly_logs.anomaly_id;
SELECT * FROM anomaly_history WHERE resolution_status = 'resolved';

SELECT historical_data.id, anomalies.anomaly_type, anomaly_history.resolution_status FROM historical_data LEFT JOIN anomalies ON historical_data.id = anomalies.affected_data_id LEFT JOIN anomaly_history ON anomalies.anomaly_id = anomaly_history.anomaly_id ORDER BY historical_data.id ASC, anomaly_history.timestamp DESC;
SELECT * FROM historical_data LIMIT 10;
SELECT id, timestamp, value FROM historical_data WHERE data_type = 'Temperature' ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT * FROM anomalies WHERE anomaly_score > 0.7 ORDER BY detection_timestamp ASC;
SELECT id, anomaly_type, anomaly_description FROM anomalies WHERE detection_timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-02-01' ORDER BY anomaly_type;
SELECT anomaly_id, timestamp, resolution_status FROM anomaly_history WHERE resolution_status = true ORDER BY resolved_timestamp DESC;
SELECT * FROM historical_data ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT id, data_type, value FROM historical_data WHERE data_type = 'temperature' AND value > 100 ORDER BY value DESC;
SELECT anomaly_type, anomaly_description FROM anomalies WHERE anomaly_score > 0.8 ORDER BY anomaly_score DESC;
SELECT source_name, location FROM data_sources WHERE location LIKE '%USA%' ORDER BY source_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM anomaly_history WHERE resolution_status = false ORDER BY timestamp ASC;
